subject: Re: [junit] Testing a plugin manager
msgSnippet: Hello Josh, I would suggest creating a mock file.  Something along these lines: public class MockFile extends java.io.File { private File[] filesList; public
messageBody:
Hello Josh,

I would suggest creating a mock file. Something along these lines:
public class MockFile extends java.io.File {
private File[] filesList;

public MockFile() {
...
}

public void setListFiles(File[] files) {
filesList = files;
}

public File[] listFiles() {
return filesList;
}

...
}

Your plugin manager probably accepts a File as a root somehow, so, in your unit
tests your would instantiate this MockFile and pass that. In the real code,
you would pass an instance of java.io.File instead.

Hope that helps !
Francois Beausoleil


--- Josh Knowles <josh.knowles@...> a écrit : > I have a
